title: How do Russian soldiers compare to British soldiers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here is a Joke I came across online, Bring a bunch of SAS into a Pub and you get a fight. Bring a bunch of Spetsnaz into a Pub and you get a party. ————————————————————————————————— The British proved in the Falklands War, that they could kick ass in a country Kilometres away, on their own, with no direct US support. However, this was Cold War Britain, not Modern Britain. (Glory to the Metric System) The Russians proved that they can support their forces in a Country Kilometres away, in Syria, and maintain operational tempo. Modern Russia, never had an opponent like Argentina to the British, which had actually engaged Royal Navy Ships Modern Britain, never had an opportunity like Syria, instead having to rely on either NATO framework or the US, to assist in most of their logistics.  Answering the Question itself, and referencing the above. A fictional account. “Remember Yuri?” Commander Nicholas sits at a bar, smiling at his Russian counterpart. “Yes my friend,” Commander Yuri smiles, taking a shot of Vodka. He ruffles his pockets, taking out a picture. “This was my first parade, the 1984 May Day Parade. I was proud of what I stood for,” he smirks, recollecting. “Things were so much easier back then,” Nicholas smiles. “My Great Grandfather was an Admiral of the Royal Navy,” as he shows Yuri a picture. “You know. In 1984, We’d be more than happy to let the Baltics loose. We didn’t like them so much” Yuri laughs. “Well, and if you bastards invaded, we’d be very happy to nuke France,” Nicholas responds in kind, “Another Waterloo!” Yuri punches Nicholas’ shoulder as they down another shot. “Russia and Britain has many sad fates. We were once Mighty. Your country’s influence stretched from East to West. So did mine, from East to East!” Yuri laughs. Nicholas sighs. “Come my friend, let me show you pictures of my Dacha.”

My father served in the Polish Military in WWII.The Russian military had great respect for that army because they had such a will to fight on despite being poorly equipped and not always the best fed army either.The Russian military and there allies,like the Polish, various partesans and others were responsible,more than anyone else for defeating Adolf Hitler.I am not going to put down the British or the Americans or say they were of no consequence.That would be absurd.The Russians were used to doing without as much food,were more able to tolerate the climate, especially the cold winters than the British and some of the Americans,but then again,if an American came from San Francisco as opposed to northern Wisconsin there cold tolerance would be very different as was true for the Russians.Being born and raised in Kamchatka will toughen you to the cold, Tajikistan,not so much.I really can't say much about today's Russian soldiers as compared to those who fought in WWII.I hope,as an American that our two nations will learn to coexist and perhaps one day have a positive relationship.I hope for peace because both of our countries have seen too much war.I know that all soldiers suffer when they are wounded and it sickens me to think of any nation going to war for greed and power as did the axis forces in WWII and as some still do.I am wandering off topic because I know that the Russian people are good people with bad leaders and it saddens me to think of them fighting and being wounded or dying for some nonsense there leaders have decided is important.The English too can do with more peace and as for my country,we have not known peace in decades.It would be a great think for it to return.

To answer the question originally posed I would say that soldier for soldier Russian and British along with other key military powers are about equal. They all learn from one another, watch their potential opponents and adapt training to match. The key difference is in the overall make up and equipment. Russia uses conscription whereas Britain is a fully professional military. Professionals will almost always be better than conscripts. A professional wants to be there so will have the moral and the interest. Not so a conscript. It is also the professionals that will receive the best training. So professional to professional there is probably little difference. I don’t think anyone would question the skills of the SAS v Spetsnaz, or the Russian Naval Infantry v the Royal Marines. But the conscripts? On the equipment front both countries have their issues, budgets mainly. Russia has some good equipment but also has a lot of rubbish. Britain has less but what it does have tends to be top end. They don’t hang on to out of date weapons in the same way Russia does. The other thing to consider when comparing the forces is what they are intended for. Britain is about power projection. It needs to be able to fight world wide to protect its widely spread interests. Russia is more about defence of the country. Training and equipment reflects the different needs. Also Russia has to depend only on itself whereas Britain mostly has NATO at hand. Occasionally there are lone skirmishes such as the Falklands but most operations are multinational or Anglo American. Again this will be reflected in training and equipment choices. Make no mistake though. I wouldn’t recommend anyone picking a fight with either. And hopefully we won’t pick a fight with each other or we’re all in the shit!
Russian Soldiers always comes up best compared to British soldiers because the Russian soldiers does not have to rely on US for anything whenever things get difficult ..
